text: Edgecombe Community College is a public education institution located in Tarboro, North Carolina. ==History== Edgecombe Technical Institute opened as an extension unit of Wilson County Technical Institute in 1967. In August 1968, the new school held its first classes. In 1987, the college was renamed Edgecombe Community College and has since expanded its campus size. In January 2016, ECC opened a 45,000 sq foot Biotechnology and Medical Simulation Center on the Rocky Mount campus. In 2018, Dr. Deborah Lamm retired from President of ECC,http://www.rockymounttelegram.com/News/2018/06/07/Event-introduces-three- ECC-president-finalists.html eventually being replaced by Dr. Gregory McLeod, ECC's first black president. ==Campus== Campus in downtown Rocky Mount The campus spans 120 acres and is located 2.5 miles south of Tarboro and composed of 11 buildings. Edgecombe also operates a separate campus at Rocky Mount.https://www.nccommunitycolleges.edu/about-us/remote-satellite- campuses/rocky-mount-campus ==Student Life== The student body is 75% Female, 25% male with over 2000 students. 55% come from out of the county. There is a Travel Abroad Program enabling students and staff to travel to a variety of locations such as France, Spain, Italy and Scotland. ==Programs== Edgecombe Community College offers more than 130 academic degrees, diplomas, and certificateshttps://www.edgecombe.edu/about/ecc50/ ==References== Category:North Carolina Community College System colleges Category:Education in Edgecombe County, North Carolina Category:Educational institutions established in 1968 Category:Two-year colleges in the United States Category:1968 establishments in North Carolina
